In which destinies will they go? What is the shape of the intermediate existence that arises?
Verse:
Because this is attracted by one karma, it is like the form of the future fundamental existence.
The fundamental existence refers to the period after death but before rebirth.
The treatise says:
If karma can attract the future destiny to which one will go, that karma will also attract the intermediate existence that can go there.
Therefore, if this intermediate existence is going to that destiny, it will have the form of the fundamental existence of that destiny.
If so, in the womb of a single dog, intermediate existences of the five destinies could suddenly arise.
Since there is a hell intermediate existence present, how can it not burn the mother's womb?
Even when dwelling in the fundamental existence, it does not always burn.
It is like temporarily visiting a garden, let alone being in the intermediate existence.
Even if it is granted that it can be burned, it cannot be seen or touched, because the body of the intermediate state is extremely subtle. Therefore your objection is unreasonable.
Although the intermediate state beings of the various destinies are in the same womb, they do not touch or burn each other, because this is prevented by karma.
The size of the intermediate state being of the desire realm is like that of a child five or six years old, but its faculties are clear and sharp.

The intermediate state being of a bodhisattva is like a person in the prime of life, with a body that is round and full and endowed with all the major marks. Therefore, when it is in the intermediate state and about to enter the womb, it illuminates a hundred koá¹­is of great trichiliocosms.
If this is so, why did the mother of the Bodhisattva see in a dream an elephant calf coming in through her right side?

Also, the intermediate beings enter through the birth passage, not by breaking the mother's abdomen to enter the womb. Therefore, twins are born first small and later large.
How does the Dharma master explain this?

The size of the intermediate being in the form realm is complete, like the original existence.
Born together with clothes, due to the increase of shame and modesty. The intermediate being of the Bodhisattva is also born together with clothes.

What is the substance of what is similar to the original existence?
It is said that the aggregates before death and after birth are collectively called the substance of existence, which is the five appropriated aggregates.
Within this, the different stages are analyzed into four:
The first is the intermediate existence, the meaning of which was explained above.
The second is birth existence, which refers to the moment of rebirth in the various destinies.
The third is prior existence, which refers to all stages except for the moment of birth and before death.

Next, in front of the intermediate existence, sentient beings with form are endowed with all four existences. If they are in the formless realm, they lack one and are endowed with three.

Verse:
The same pure heavenly eye sees, with karmic powers swift and complete faculties,
Imperturbable, untransferable, eating fragrance, not abiding long.
With inverted mind, one seeks the realm of desire; the wet and transformed are tainted by fragrant places.
The heavenly head is above, the three are horizontal; the head of hell returns downward.
The treatise says:

The bodies of those in the intermediate state see each other of the same kind. If one has cultivated and attained the extremely pure heavenly eye, one can also see them. All eyes obtained through birth cannot observe them, because they are extremely subtle.
Some other masters say:
The heavenly intermediate state eye is fully able to see.
The intermediate state beings of the five destinies, humans, ghosts, animals, and hells, see four, three, two, and one respectively, excluding the higher ones.

Among all spiritual powers, the spiritual power of karma is the swiftest. It is called spiritual power because it freely surpasses the sky. Spiritual power obtained through karma is called the spiritual power of karma. This spiritual power is called swift because its power is fast.
There are those who attain the most rapid karmic powers, and even the World-Honored One cannot stop them, because the power of their karma is the strongest.
All intermediate beings are endowed with the five faculties. Obstruction means obstruction. This cannot be blocked by vajra and other things, so it is called unobstructed.

It is heard that when a red-hot iron ball is broken apart, insects are seen born inside. Therefore, the intermediate existence of those who should go to that realm has already arisen. All kinds of power cannot change it, meaning that one cannot cause the intermediate existence to disappear and another intermediate existence to arise. It is the same for other types.
The intermediate existence that should go to that realm has already arisen. It can only go there, definitely not elsewhere.
Does the body of the intermediate existence of the desire realm rely on coarse food?
Although it relies on coarse food, it is subtle, not coarse.
What is the subtle one?
It refers only to fragrance. For this reason, it obtains the name Gandharva.
Because the meanings in the various syllable realms are not one, and the short sounds are like sektantu and ká¹›ktantu, the omission is not a fault.
Those with little merit only eat foul-smelling food, while those with much merit eat good-smelling food.
For how long do such intermediate beings remain?
The Venerable One says:
There is no fixed limit for this.

As long as the conditions for rebirth are not met, the intermediate being always exists. Because their life faculty is not attracted by separate karma, it is the same as the general destiny of the person they are to become.
If it were otherwise, when the life faculty of the intermediate being finally ceased, it would be established as the intermediate existence at death.
Even if a mass of flesh equal to Mount Sumeru were to turn into a mass of insects during the rainy season in summer,
one should say that the various intermediate beings gradually wait for this time?
Or is it said that they suddenly come here from some direction?
Although there are no scriptures or treatises that clearly explain this, according to the correct principles, one should say:

There are countless miscellaneous births. Attached to smells and tastes, their lifespans are short. Those sentient beings, due to smelling this smell and being greedy for smells and tastes, die together at the same time. Due to the karma of craving and awareness that previously attracted the body of an insect, they simultaneously receive the body of a small insect here.

Or many sentient beings should be born together here, but many conditions have not yet come together, so they dwell in the intermediate state. Now encountering many conditions, they suddenly take birth here.

Those who should be born together definitely do not differ in time. Just as there is karma that can attract the results of being a wheel-turning king, it must be when the lifespan of humans is eighty thousand years or more than that before it suddenly gives results, not in other states.
This should also be so.
Therefore the World-Honored One said:
The differences in the karmic results of sentient beings are inconceivable.
Venerable Vasumitra said:
This lasts at most seven days. If the conditions for birth have not come together, they die and are reborn many times.
Other masters say:
At most seven times seven days.

If the conditions for birth are not immediately present, then the power of karma causes the conditions to be present.
If the conditions are not present, then the intermediate being is born in a similar class in another place. Some say that the intermediate being is transformed and born in a similar class.
For example, the increase of desire for a house cow, dog, bear, and horse is in summer, autumn, winter, and spring, respectively. Wild cows, wild dogs, and donkeys have no fixed time.

In this way, the intermediate being who is about to reach the place of rebirth first gives rise to a perverted mind that rushes toward the sexual organs. If male, the embryo abides in the mother's right side, facing the back, squatting; if female, it abides in the mother's left side, facing the abdomen.
If it is not male or female, it abides in the womb according to the craving that arose.

In this matter, we should further investigate: by the power of karma, does the semen and blood element immediately become the basis of the faculties?
Or does karma separately produce the element that is the basis of the faculties, which depends on the semen and blood and abides in it?
Some say:

The semen and blood immediately become the basis of the faculties. This means that the previous intermediate existence without faculties perishes together, and the subsequent intermediate existence with faculties arises without interruption, like the principle of the seed and sprout perishing and arising.

It means that the intermediate existence, either seeing one's own body being oppressed by cold rain and cold wind, or seeing the blazing flames of a hot hell, delights in the warm touch and throws oneself into it.

Moreover, if sentient beings have little merit, when entering the mother's womb, they give rise to inverted thoughts and understanding, seeing great wind and rain, poisonous heat and severe cold, or the clamor and intimidation of a great army, and thus see themselves entering a dense forest of grass, a leaf hut, a thatched cottage, or throwing themselves under a tree or wall. If merit is abundant, when entering the mother's womb, they give rise to inverted thoughts and understanding, seeing themselves entering a wonderful garden, ascending a flower platform, dwelling on an excellent bed, etc. Dwelling and leaving are as before.
This is called the one with wrong knowledge in the three periods.

If one is able to know correctly in all three states, then when entering, abiding, and leaving the womb, one has no inverted thoughts and understanding. Moreover, the four types of entering the womb are specifically explained. The first three are the wheel-turning king, the solitary enlightened one, and the great enlightened one, in their respective order.
The first type of entering the womb is the wheel-turning king. He knows correctly when entering the womb, but not when abiding or leaving.
The second type of entering the womb is the solitary enlightened one. He knows correctly when entering and abiding in the womb, but not when leaving.
The third type of entering the womb is the unsurpassed enlightened one. He is able to know correctly when entering, abiding, and leaving the womb.
These first three people are distinguished by their future names.
Why are they not the same in these three categories?
This is because their karma and wisdom are superior in their respective order.
The first is superior in karma. This refers to the wheel-turning king, who in his past lives cultivated vast blessings.
The second is superior in wisdom. This refers to the solitary enlightened one, who for a long time has studied and contemplated much.
The third are those who are superior in both, namely, those who attain supreme enlightenment, because they cultivate superior merit and wisdom for a long time.
Excluding the above three, the remaining sentient beings born from wombs and eggs are inferior in both merit and wisdom, and together form the fourth category.
Among them, the non-Buddhists who grasp the self say:
If you admit that sentient beings transmigrate to other worlds, then the meaning of the self that we grasp is established.
Now, in order to refute them, the verse says:
There is no self, only the aggregates, created by afflictions and karma.
Due to the continuity of the intermediate state, one enters the womb like a flame.
Like the gradual increase of attraction, the continuity is due to afflictions and karma.
One goes again to another world, therefore there is a wheel without a beginning.
The treatise says:
What is the characteristic of the self that you grasp?
It is definitely not the case that there is an inner active person who abandons this aggregate and continues the other aggregates, because like form, the eye, etc., it cannot be apprehended.
The World-Honored One also said:

That is, it is able to abandon this aggregate and continue the other aggregates, except for the nominal dharma.
What is the nominal dharma?
It is said that when this exists, that exists, and when this arises, that arises, extensively explaining dependent origination.
If so, why is the self not refuted?
There is only the aggregates, that is, the name of self is only nominally established on the aggregates, and it is not to be refuted.
If so, one should admit that the aggregates themselves can pass from this world to another world.

The aggregates perish in a moment, and are unable to revolve, but because of being done by afflictions and karma cultivated many times, the aggregates of the intermediate state continue and enter the womb.
For example, although the flame of a lamp perishes in a moment, it is able to continue and move to another place.

The same is true of the aggregates, so there is no error in calling it passing. Therefore, although there is no self, the meaning of the continuity of the aggregates passing into the womb through afflictions and karma is established.

The aggregates continue in a series, increasing in size in accordance with the order in which they were attracted by karma. They are then reborn in another world through the power of the passions and karma. That is, not all the aggregates that are attracted increase in size and continue in a series for a long or short time, because there are differences in the causes that attract and sustain life.
In accordance with the power of the karma that attracts them, they increase in size in a series for a certain period of time.
What is the order?

This arrow in the womb gradually grows, and even the sense organs and bodily features are filled, by the power of the karmic retribution wind that arises from karma, it turns the arrow in the womb and makes it move towards the birth canal.

Sometimes the mother's behavior, diet, and work are excessive, or due to the child's past evil karma, it dies in the womb.

At that time, there is a woman or a doctor who is skilled in the art of childbirth and good at caring for infants, she warms with ghee, oil, and pomegranate juice to apply to her hands, and holds a small sharp knife.

Inside, it is like a cesspool, the most extremely filthy and foul-smelling, filled with various impurities, dwelling in darkness, the abode of countless thousands of insects, constantly flowing with evil juices that must always be treated, with semen, blood, dirt, grease, festering, foul-smelling, slippery, overflowing with impurities, disgusting and unobservable, covered with a thin, perforated skin on top.

However, this fetus is riding on what was done in past lives, and the direction of the karma to be experienced in the future is difficult to understand.
Or, without difficulty, it is born safely, and the body is like a new wound, delicate and difficult to touch.
Either the mother loves the child or another woman, with two hands as rough as knives and ashes, holds it, washes and wipes it, and places it.

Next, it sucks on fresh ghee and drinks the mother's milk, gradually causing it to become accustomed to fine and coarse food. It gradually increases until it reaches maturity, and again gives rise to afflictions and accumulates karma.
Because of this, the body perishes, and again there is a continuation of the intermediate state as before, and it goes to another world.

In this way, because delusion and karma are the causes, there is birth. Birth again becomes the cause, giving rise to delusion and karma. From this delusion and karma, there is again birth. Therefore, we know that the wheel of existence revolves without beginning.
If one grasps that it has a beginning, the beginning should be without a cause.
If the beginning is without a cause, the rest should arise by themselves.
It is currently seen that sprouts, etc. are born from seeds, etc., because the place and time are both determined.

Therefore, birth and death definitely have no beginning, but they do have an end, because the causes are exhausted.
Because birth depends on causes, when the causes are destroyed, the born effect must perish. This principle must be so.

In this way, the continuity of the aggregates is said to have three stages of birth.

Because of this pursuit, one accumulates karma that can attract future results. This stage is called becoming.
Due to the power of this karma, one abandons this life and immediately connects with future existence. This stage is called birth.

This old age and death is the four stages of name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling in the present world.
